title: ID a sans serif font with rounded terminals
content:
This picture is for Hiragino Maru Gothic Pro (japanese and western characters) that I have installed on my computer. But there are problems with using this font for Latin characters and I was wondering if there is something similar, but better that you know about.

It should be just as simple and have rounded terminals. I only need the uppercase letters.

Thanks.

 ![](http://web.archive.org/web/20090413032202im_/http:/typophile.com/files/font_sample_4765.png)

| Attachment | Size |
| --- | --- |
| [font\_sample.png](http://web.archive.org/web/20090413032202/http:/typophile.com/files/font_sample.png) | 15.31 KB |
author: juozasg

comments.content:
Helvetica or [Arial](http://web.archive.org/web/20090413032202/http:/new.myfonts.com/fonts/agfa/arial/rounded-mt/) both have rounded versions.

[edit: the Helvetica Rounded seems to be Bold or Black weights only)

- Mike Yanega
